utterances.utterance: It's a pot cast. It's more like a pot cast.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Seriously.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: This is, like, a real thing. Like, there's a couple different groups. You've got Richard Branson.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I've got to tell you, obviously I could not afford something like that. Also, I would never go, because I don't really have any interest.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Please. Chump change.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I will say that the elite in this country and in Europe, and increasingly so in Asia, they'll spend $160,000 on a private flight to go overseas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So $200,000 per person. I bet there's a lot of people who would take him up on this.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I think for Virgin -- or for Jeff Bezos. What is it, Virgin Galactic. They already have people that have signed up. Jesse, are you are on board with this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: On board, nice one. Yes, I would go. I don't think people would want me to come back, though. I think they'd like me to stay up there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Be a one-shot wonder.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't get him the round trip. Just give him the one way.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: May be a discounted price.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's right, that's right. I'd try anything.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So I've got to -- I've got to find a way to get $800,000 by next year.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: You could do a GoFundMe campaign.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because I can take the four space cadets that I would love to see go into --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Good one, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But I must say, so --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's very mean to say that about "The View."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, you got it. I was thinking, oh, you mean, you actually go into outer space. But actually, you don't. You just go a couple miles. I think it's, like, 60 miles up.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: That makes it less scary.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Then you get to see the curvature of the earth. The scary part, Lisa, was then they drop you with a parachute. You don't land.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No thanks.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You splash into the ocean?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but you've got a parachute on you. I think that's what happens.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Dana, so the big problem here is there is polling on this. And, like, 58 percent of Americans are like, "This is too scary. I don't want to do this." I mean, how do they change these numbers?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think partly, as Greg was saying earlier, that people look at new technologies and they're usually wrong initially. You think, "Well, I'll never do that. That was true of bicycles and vehicles, like actual cars. And now we have driverless cars. We're starting to get a little more comfortable with that idea.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: People were afraid of bicycles?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They called them the two-wheeled murderer.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I fell off one when I first tried riding bike.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you got back up on it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They thought that people were going to get hurt, that it was going to cause problems. Yes, like, everything that's new takes a while to get used to.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A pencil sharpener. People were scared to death of it. People were using it incorrectly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: The electric pencil sharpener?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Real quick, so we've got a no?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Jesse, yes.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm sending you guys.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Great.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'll borrow your tin foil hat.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I think I'm too much of a chicken for this. Maybe --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'll watch the video.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I'll cheer other people on. All right. Well, stay tuned, because "One More Thing" is coming up next, and you're not going to want to miss it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. "One More Thing" -- Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you know, I'm just back from the Major League Baseball all-star game.

utterances.speaker: I want to tell you
utterances.utterance: take a look at my new personal baseball card. Yes, that's me right there with Sean Doolittle of the Nationals. And here I am with J.T. Realmuto of Miami, their all-star catcher. But the big personal drama came when I was on the field. Take a look behind me if you will. You see those dark clouds? I just made it to the Nationals dugout before the rains came, but then came the deluge. It was an epic rain. For an hour, a hard rain, and as you can see, it flooded the dugout and stranded our TV crew in there. We couldn't get out. But then the sun came out, and the all-stars put on their own thunder and lightning show. Eight home runs. What a great time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The whole package tomorrow. Greg, I'm going to have a whole package on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Excellent. We shall look forward to it. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We will. All right, so I have a podcast, too. It's called "I'll Tell You What." I do have Chris Stirewalt, and that hasn't -- there's a new one up today so you can listen to that. And his two young boys have asked a favor of "The Five." So I said that, OK, we will give it a shot. They recently watched a -- "Field of Dreams," and they loved the movie. They love baseball. They went to the homerun derby. And they say that this mystery of who the voice is that says this, listen.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: If you build it, he will come.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Nice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So apparently, there's a big mystery as to who that voice actually is. For a long time, Ray Liotta was the leading contender among fans, but in 2014, D.P. Kinsella -- the was the author -- suggested Ed Harris but admitted that was just based on rumors. So the boys want to know who actually is the voice that says, "If you build it, they will come."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: A creepy voice.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Mystery solved, Lou Dobbs. OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Lou Dobbs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: If you really know, tweet me. We'll figure it out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. I also have a podcast. It's with Daniela Greenbaum. She was involved in a big controversy when she was forced to resign -- no, not forced to resign, she resigned from her columnist spot at Business Insider. utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.utterance: Greg's Cable News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "Greg's Cable News." Well, I decided to get up really early and watch a show called "Morning Joe." And this is me. I often film myself while watching other shows.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And I was just -- it's a very slow-moving show. And I just tried to stay awake, because Mika just prattles on, and Joe just sits there looking like Joe. utterances.utterance: Do these people ever respond to you, or do they just ignore you?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They ignore me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Probably wise.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. To you, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't have a podcast, but I have this. There is a new "Guinness Book of World Records," which has been shattered by this guy. He slices watermelons on his stomach with a machete.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And he crushed it. He sliced 26.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: My God.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Why would you do that?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There wasn't even a "Guinness Book of World Record" for this. He suggested it to Guinness, and they said, "Sure, why not?" And he has another record.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: This is so dumb.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you think this is some kind of turn on?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm going to turn it into a world record thing, but it's actually a fetish.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You think he likes that? In a sexual way?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm not so sure, Greg. On another topic for your podcast.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: All right. Moving on. Full disclosure, I'm a senior fellow for the Independent Women's Voice. They do pay me, but I'm doing this on my own volition. So they're watching Champion Woman. Far too often, you often see voices on the right get shut down. There's a lot of name calling. You see that with people like Sarah Huckabee Sanders. So they are watching Champion Woman, where they're encouraging people across different ideologies and partisanship to respect each other, to not criticize each other in that way, to promote each other's success and to cheer each other on, so it's a good thing. www.ChampionWoman.com.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm against that.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: You want it to be all women?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I want to be on record to be against something everybody is for.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Wait a second --

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: It doesn't happen every day.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's true. I can testify.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That is true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Can I join or is it only women?

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: I can't answer that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan wants to join because it's just women.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That could be.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my goodness. Terrible.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I respect your disclosure of your financial status. Very respectable.

utterances.speaker: BOOTHE
utterances.utterance: Coming from you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Terrible man. He's a terrible, terrible man. All right. We've got to move on. Never miss an episode of "The Five." If you want news with great hair, here's our guy, Bret Baier. Where is Bret? There he is.
